comms_internal: The preverb kon- means «out», e.g. out of a house into the street. For going out up from below the preverb nox- would be required, e.g. a mouse out of a hole up to the ground.

comms_internal: poxǝn is a postposition. As a first reaction they always say just the verb joxtuŋkw ‘to come’.

alternative is karsmaptas (cf. āji-riɕ kūt’uw karsmapt-as [girl-dim dog touch_accidently-pst.3sg], ‘Девочка случайно дотронулась до собаки / The girl accidently touched the dog’) with the valency pattern TR. Both are natural sentences, nowxatas was preferred as an intransitive pattern.
the verb is originally a reflexive.
